newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian soymeal prices lifted by firm export demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian soymeal prices lifted by firm export demand.

text.p: Soymeal prices rose by $8-10 per tonne in the past two days on firm export demand, traders said on Friday.
They said soymeal was quoted at $288-290 per tonne FAS, compared with around $280 per tonne on Wednesday.
"Indian exporters are offering small quantities at higher prices," said one oilmeal broker.
Traders said they had so far contracted to export 1.85 million tonnes of soymeal in 1996/97 (Nov-Oct).
They said daily soybean arrivals were around 3,000 tonnes in central Indian markets compared with 15,000 tonnes a year ago.
Soybeans were quoted at 11,600-11,900 rupees per tonne against 9,650-9,900 rupees at the same time last year.
